etymologies: late Middle English (denoting a cupel used to treat gold or silver alloys or ore): via Old French from Latin testu, testum ‘earthen pot’, variant of testa ‘jug, shell’. Compare with test. The verb dates from the early 17th century

definitions: a procedure intended to establish the quality, performance, or reliability of something, especially before it is taken into widespread use

examples.text: no sparking was visible during the tests

shortDefinitions: procedure intended to establish quality, performance, or reliability of something

definitions: a short written or spoken examination of a person's proficiency or knowledge
shortDefinitions: short written or spoken examination of person's proficiency or knowledge

definitions: an event or situation that reveals the strength or quality of someone or something by putting them under strain

examples.text: this is the first serious test of the peace agreement

shortDefinitions: event or situation that reveals strength or quality of person or thing by putting them under strain

definitions: an examination of part of the body or a body fluid for medical purposes, especially by means of a chemical or mechanical procedure rather than simple inspection

examples.text: researchers developed a test for the virus

shortDefinitions: examination of part of body or body fluid for medical purposes

definitions: a procedure employed to identify a substance or to reveal the presence or absence of a constituent within a substance.
shortDefinitions: procedure employed to identify substance or to reveal presence or absence of constituent within substance

definitions: the result of a medical examination or analytical procedure
shortDefinitions: result of medical examination or analytical procedure

definitions: a means of establishing whether an action, item, or situation is an instance of a specified quality, especially one held to be undesirable
shortDefinitions: means of establishing whether action, item, or situation is instance of specified quality

definitions: a movable hearth in a reverberating furnace, used for separating gold or silver from lead.
shortDefinitions: movable hearth in reverberating furnace, used for separating gold or silver from lead

phrases.text: put someone or something to the test

definitions: take measures to check the quality, performance, or reliability of (something), especially before putting it into widespread use or practice

examples.text: this range has not been tested on animals
the testing and developing of prototypes
a useful way to test out ideas before implementation

shortDefinitions: take measures to check quality, performance, or reliability of something

definitions: give (someone) a short written or oral examination of their proficiency or knowledge

examples.text: all children are tested at eleven

shortDefinitions: give someone short written or oral examination of their proficiency or knowledge

definitions: judge or measure (someone's proficiency or knowledge) by means of an examination

examples.text: the exam will test accuracy and neatness

shortDefinitions: judge or measure someone's proficiency or knowledge by means of test

definitions: reveal the strengths or capabilities of (someone or something) by putting them under strain

examples.text: such behavior would severely test any marriage

shortDefinitions: reveal strengths or capabilities of person or thing by putting them under strain

definitions: carry out a medical test on (a person, a part of the body, or a body fluid)
produce a specified result in a medical test, especially a drug test or AIDS test

examples.text: he tested positive for steroids after the race

shortDefinitions: produce specified result in medical test

definitions: examine (a substance) by means of a reagent.
shortDefinitions: examine substance by means of reagent

definitions: touch or taste (something) to check that it is acceptable before proceeding further

examples.text: she tested the water with the tip of her elbow

shortDefinitions: touch or taste something to check that it is acceptable before proceeding further

phrases.text: put someone or something to the test

etymologies: mid 19th century: from Latin testa ‘tile, jug, shell’. Compare with test

definitions: the shell or integument of some invertebrates and protozoans, especially the chalky shell of a foraminiferan or the tough outer layer of a tunicate.
shortDefinitions: shell or integument of some invertebrates and protozoans
